intro: Actinostemon klotzschii, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Andes in South America. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Actinostemon klotzschii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
